thread.title: Oliver Dearlove trial: Brother of violent plasterer convicted of killing banker is already behind bars for murder
thread.title_full: Oliver Dearlove trial: Brother of violent plasterer convicted of killing banker is already behind bars for murder

author: Patrick Grafton-Green
title: Oliver Dearlove trial: Brother of violent plasterer convicted of killing banker is already behind bars for murder
text:
Thursday 23 February 2017 11:56 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Killer: Trevor Timon punched Oliver Dearlove in the head during a night out in Blackheath 
The brother of a violent plasterer convicted of killing banker Oliver Dearlove is already behind bars for murder, it has been revealed. 
Trevor Timon, 31, from Plumstead , admitted manslaughter at the Old Bailey after punching Mr Dearlove in the head during a night out in Blackheath , knocking him unconscious. 
His brother Wesley Timon, 32, was convicted in 2005 in the same court for the murder of Dean Wheaton. 
He was the ring-leader of a gang who, armed with two 12-inch kitchen knives, stabbed the 19-year-old to death in Woolwich – after accusing him of chatting up his girlfriend. 
A source told The Sun : “Trevor and Wesley are blood brothers in every respect. 
“They are violent nutters who should be left to rot in prison.” 
Oliver Dearlove, from New Eltham, never regained consciousness after being punched on August 27 last year and died in hospital the following night, surrounded by friends and family. Oliver Dearlove: Timon punched the banker after an altercation with friends (Metropolitan police) 
Trevor Timon pleaded guilty to manslaughter but was cleared of murder on Wednesday after the jury deliberated for three hours. 
He attacked Mr Dearlove after the 30-year-old struck up a conversation with a female friend about baby photos. 
Prosecutor Anthony Orchard QC revealed Trevor Timon's history of violence during the trial. 
In February 2008, when he was 22, Timon angrily shouted at a bus driver, brandishing a golf club. Oliver Dearlove died after being attacked on a night out 
In January 2010, he shouted and swore saying he would "start f*
